SEARCH

Class EPrnt

java.lang.Object
EPrnt
public abstract class EPrnt extends Object
Shortens 'System.out' to 'P': P.print(); P.println();

Also adds toggleable print statements, with optional prefix, for when you want to debug your code.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected static String
    debugPostfix
    The string that is concatenated inback of the value passed to dprint and dprintln, but NOT dprintf.
    protected static String
    debugPrefix
    The string that is concatenated infront of the value passed to dprint and dprintln, but NOT dprintf.
    protected static boolean
    debugPrinting
    Whether dprint and dprintln statements can print or not.
    static final PrintStream
    P
    P refers to System.out.

  • Field Details

    • P

      public static final PrintStream P
      P refers to System.out. Use P.print / P.println instead of System.out.print / System.out.println

    • debugPrinting

      protected static boolean debugPrinting
      Whether dprint and dprintln statements can print or not.

    • debugPrefix

      protected static String debugPrefix
      The string that is concatenated infront of the value passed to dprint and dprintln, but NOT dprintf.

    • debugPostfix

      protected static String debugPostfix
      The string that is concatenated inback of the value passed to dprint and dprintln, but NOT dprintf.

  • Method Details

    • setDebugPrinting

      public static final void setDebugPrinting(boolean canPrintDebugs)
      Toggles toggleable dprint and dprintln statements;
      Parameters:
      canPrintDebugs - whether dprint and dprintln can print or not

    • setDebugPrefix

      public static final void setDebugPrefix(String s)
      Sets the string that is printed on the same line, prior to the value that is passed into dprint and dprintln.

      setDebugPrefix("Debug: "); dprintln("a debug value"); Debug: a debug value

      Parameters:
      s - The string which precedes the printed value; set to an empty string to remove the prefix.

    • setDebugPostfix

      public static final void setDebugPostfix(String s)
      Sets the string that is printed on the same line, after the value that is passed into dprint and dprintln.

      setDebugPrefix("Debug: "); dprintln("a debug value"); Debug: a debug value

      Parameters:
      s - The string which precedes the printed value; set to an empty string to remove the prefix.

    • getDebugPrefix

      public static final String getDebugPrefix()
      Gets the string that is printed on the same line, prior to the value passed into dprint and dprintln.
      Returns:
      The string which precedes the value to be printed

    • getDebugPostfix

      public static final String getDebugPostfix()
      Gets the string that is printed on the same line, after to the value that is passed into dprint and dprintln.
      Returns:
      The string which procedes the value to be printed

    • dprint

      public static final void dprint(boolean b)
      If debugPrinting is true, it calls print(debugPrefix + b + debugPostfix)
      Parameters:
      b - the boolean value to be printed.
      See Also:

    • dprintf

      public static final void dprintf(String format, Object... args)
      If debugPrinting is true, it calls printf(debugPrefix + s)

      debugPrefix IS NOT APPLIED TO THIS METHOD

      Parameters:
      format - the String to be printed.
      args - arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string;
      See Also:
      • PrintStream.printf(String, Object)
